I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

P: stack nat

Goal:
sigma # (gamma1 A) = tau1 A ++ [#] ++ gamma A

Premises:
gamma = fix gamma (A : stack nat) : list nat := match A with | [] => [] | (x, y) :: A0 => gamma A0 ++ x ++ [#] ++ y ++ [#] end : stack nat -> list nat
tau1 = fix tau1 (X : Type) (A : stack X) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | (x, _) :: A0 => x ++ tau1 X A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> string X Arguments tau1 {X}%type_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
gamma1 = fun A : stack nat => map (fun '(x, y) => (x, x ++ [#] ++ y ++ [#])) A : stack nat -> list (list nat * list nat)
sigma = fix sigma (X : Type) (a : X) (A : CFP.stack X) {struct A} : list X := match A with | [] => [a] | (x, y) :: A0 => x ++ sigma X a A0 ++ y end : forall X : Type, X -> CFP.stack X -> list X Arguments sigma {X}%type_scope
stack = fun X : Type => list (card X) : Type -> Type Arguments stack _%type_scope
tau1_app : forall A0 B : stack ?X, tau1 (A0 ++ B) = tau1 A0 ++ tau1 B where ?X : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type]
gamma2 = fun A : stack nat => map (fun '(x, y) => (y, x ++ [#] ++ y ++ [#])) A : stack nat -> list (list nat * list nat)
MPCP = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack nat, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card nat * stack nat -> Prop
tau1_cards : forall x : list ?X, tau1 (cards x) = x where ?X : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type]
CFPP = fun '(R, a) => exists A : CFP.stack nat, A <<= R /\ A <> [] /\ sigma a A = rev (sigma a A) : CFP.stack nat * nat -> Prop
MPCPb = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack bool, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card bool * stack bool -> Prop
CFPI = fun '(R1, R2, a) => exists A1 A2 : CFP.stack nat, A1 <<= R1 /\ A2 <<= R2 /\ A1 <> [] /\ A2 <> [] /\ sigma a A1 = sigma a A2 : CFP.stack nat * CFP.stack nat * nat -> Prop
tau1_sym : forall A : stack nat, tau1 A <<= sym A
itau2_app : forall A0 B : list nat, itau2 ?P (A0 ++ B) = itau2 ?P A0 ++ itau2 ?P B where ?X : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type] ?P : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- stack ?X]
itau1_app : forall A0 B : list nat, itau1 ?P (A0 ++ B) = itau1 ?P A0 ++ itau1 ?P B where ?X : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type] ?P : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- stack ?X]
tau2_app : forall A0 B : stack ?X, tau2 (A0 ++ B) = tau2 A0 ++ tau2 B where ?X : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type]
ListEnumerabilityFacts.cum_ge : ListEnumerabilityFacts.cumulative ?L -> ?m >= ?n -> exists A0 : list ?X, ?L ?m = ?L ?n ++ A0 where ?X : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type] ?L : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- nat -> list ?X] ?n : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- nat] ?m : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- nat]
PCPX = fun (X : Type) (P : stack X) => exists A : list (card X), A <<= P /\ A <> [] /\ tau1 A = tau2 A : forall X : Type, stack X -> Prop Arguments PCPX {X}%type_scope
sym = fix sym (R : stack nat) : list nat := match R with | [] => [] | (x, y) :: R0 => x ++ y ++ sym R0 end : stack nat -> list nat
PCP = PCPX : stack nat -> Prop
der_cons : forall (P0 : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X) (u v : string ?X), (x, y) el P0 -> derivable P0 u v -> derivable P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v) where ?X : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type]
tau1_inv : forall (a : nat) (B : stack nat) (z : list nat), tau1 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list nat, (a :: x, y) el B
EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T_prod : forall (f1 : nat -> option ?X) (f2 : nat -> option ?Y), EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T' ?X f1 -> EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T' ?Y f2 -> EnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T' (?X * ?Y) (EnumerabilityFacts.prod_enum f1 f2) where ?X : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type] ?Y : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type]
ListEnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T_list : forall L : nat -> list ?X, ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' ?X L -> ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' (list ?X) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_list L) where ?X : [P : stack nat A : stack nat |- Type]
sym_app : forall P R : stack nat, sym (P ++ R) = sym P ++ sym R
iPCPb = fun P : stack bool => exists A : list nat, (forall a : nat, a el A -> a < | P |) /\ A <> [] /\ itau1 P A = itau2 P A : stack bool -> Prop
itau1 = fix itau1 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => fst (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau1 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau1 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
itau2 = fix itau2 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => snd (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau2 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau2 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
map_last : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (a : A), map f (l ++ [a]) = map f l ++ [f a]
app_inj_tail : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a b : A), x ++ [a] = y ++ [b] -> x = y /\ a = b
map_eq_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l1 l2 : list B), map f l = l1 ++ l2 -> exists l1' l2' : list A, l = l1' ++ l2' /\ map f l1' = l1 /\ map f l2' = l2
tau2 = fix tau2 (X : Type) (A : stack X) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | (_, y) :: A0 => y ++ tau2 X A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> string X Arguments tau2 {X}%type_scope

app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = [a] -> x = [] /\ y = [a] \/ x = [a] /\ y = []
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
ListEnumerabilityFacts.cumulative = fun (X : Type) (L : nat -> list X) => forall n : nat, exists A : list X, L (S n) = L n ++ A : forall X : Type, (nat -> list X) -> Prop Arguments ListEnumerabilityFacts.cumulative {X}%type_scope _%function_scope

removelast_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a : A), removelast (l ++ [a]) = l

last_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (a d : A), last (l ++ [a]) d = a
app_nth2_plus : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (d : A) (n : nat), nth ((| l |) + n) (l ++ l') d = nth n l' d
